definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: I have been elected best goalkeeper by the South America Foot-ball Federation in succession three years in a row.
sentences.chinese: 我连续三年被南美足球联合会推举为最佳守门员。

sentences.english: Each group selected candidates to run for president and vice-president.
sentences.chinese: 每个组推举出候选人参加总统和副总统竞选。

sentences.english: Agood face is a letter of recommendation.
sentences.chinese: 好的相貌就是一封推举的介绍信。

sentences.english: These parties together can only field a fraction of candidates.
sentences.chinese: 即使联合在一起，这些政党只能推举部分候选人。
他们以欢呼声推举他为大会主席。

sentences.english: The next year, the Democrats met in the same saloon to select their nominees.
sentences.chinese: 次年，民主党人在同一家酒吧开会推举候选人。

sentences.english: Some staffers were pushing the passengers to help them get in.
sentences.chinese: 一些车站的工作人员正在推举着乘客，协助他们上车。

sentences.english: My friend recommended to me the Nan Fung Industrial Center. How is it?
sentences.chinese: 我友人向我推举南丰工业中央，这大厦怎么样呢？

sentences.english: We all voted for him as our representative.
We elected him monitor of our class .
sentences.chinese: 我们推举他为我班班长。

sentences.english: He was celebrated: elected to the College de France and the Academie des Sciences...
sentences.chinese: 他很有名，被推举到法国科学院。

definition: to succeed sb in a job/successor
public decision (by ballot)/majority decision/a joint decision/referendum
to fill a post/to act as
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to propose (for a job)/to nominate/to recommend
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
